moves.2... exf4: I accept it, probably the best!
moves.3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4 g4: Threatening the bishop away with this pawn-push.
moves.5. Ne5 Qh4+: Check! Starting an attack on Whites exposed king.
moves.6. g3 fxg3 7. Kf1 gxh2 8. Qxg4 Qxg4: Exchange of the queens nearly totally stop the attack!
moves.11. Be2 dxe4: Winning a pawn in the center!
moves.12. Nxh2 Bh3+ 13. Kf2 Nf6: Starting to develop new pieces for a new attack on Whites king!
moves.14. Nc3 Bc5+: I have a lead in development! This will lead to something positive for me!
moves.17. Kf4: It´s NEVER good to start wandering up on the board with the king. It´s dangerous, he can be mated or lose material when he tries to avoiding being mated!
moves.17... Be6 18. Nxe4 Nxe4: White can´t take back with the king. If he does that then Bd5+ will win the white rook.
moves.19. Bg4 Nf2: A little tactical blast with the black knight!
moves.21. Nxg4 Rxg4+ 22. Kf3 Rg6 23. c3: Black is leading in material with two light pieces! It seems like this game is lost for white!
moves.23... Nd7 24. d4 Be7 25. Bf4 Nf6 26. Re2: A big mistake! Leads to Bg4+! Wins the rook!
moves.26... Bg4+ 27. Kf2 Bxe2 28. Kxe2 O-O-O: 0-0-0 leads to that my other rook will come in in the game quicker!
moves.29. d5 Rxd5: And white gives up! Nothing else to do.
